title: Does My State Have a COVID-19 Vaccine App?
author: Chandra Steele
description: There are lots of ways to carry proof of a COVID-19 vaccine on your phone, but some US states have developed their own apps, vaccine passports, or portals. Here's the state-by-state rundown.
cleaned_text: Though we still have a long way to go before COVID-19 is a thing of the past, part of the way to get there is with vaccinations. Workplaces, restaurants, and events are all safer when those who inhabit them are vaccinated. Fewer and fewer states have vaccine mandates (you can find an [updated list on AARP](https://www.aarp.org/politics-society/government-elections/info-2020/coronavirus-state-restrictions.html)), but nevertheless, some states offer mobile solutions to store proof of vaccination on your phone. The white cards that are issued with your first vaccination and updated for each successive one can be easily misplaced. And while there are many ways to [carry your card on your phone](https://www.pcmag.com/how-to/how-to-carry-your-vaccination-card-on-your-phone), healthcare or state workers who have to follow regulations might be in need of an official state-approved app. Here's a list of the ones we've found; in some states, lawmakers and governors have moved to ban so-called vaccine passports. In states that have them, some let you store a digital copy of your card in the app, some give you a digital copy that you can save in other apps, and some give you access to a record that says you're vaccinated, which may or may not be accepted by a venue or workplace. Regulations that affect digital records change frequently. We'll do our best to keep this list updated, but if you want the latest information, it's a good bet that [your state's department of health website](https://www.cdc.gov/publichealthgateway/healthdirectories/healthdepartments.html) has what you need to know. Alabama Alabama does not offer digital proof of vaccination. In May, 2021, Gov. Kay Ivey signed legislation that bans vaccine passports, according to [the AP](https://apnews.com/article/al-state-wire-alabama-coronavirus-pandemic-business-health-aa34e75ca887513d6bb09525cdd6d627). Alaska Alaska uses the [Docket app](https://health.alaska.gov/dph/Epi/iz/Pages/records.aspx). Arizona Arizona uses [MyIR Mobile](https://app.myirmobile.com/auth/sign-in?state=AZ). Arkansas Arkansas uses the [Smart Health Card system](https://www.healthy.arkansas.gov/images/uploads/pdf/SMART_Health_Card_FAQs.pdf). California California has a [statewide app](https://myvaccinerecord.cdph.ca.gov/). Colorado Colorado has the [myColorado app](https://mycolorado.state.co.us/myvaccine-record). Connecticut Connecticut uses [CT WiZ](https://ctwiz.dph.ct.gov/ctwiz_public/Application/PublicPortal), which lets you download your records. Delaware Delaware uses Smart Health Cards, accessible via the [DelVAX web portal](https://delvax.dhss.delaware.gov/delvax_public/Application/PublicPortal). Florida Florida does not offer digital proof of vaccination. In May, 2021, Gov. Ron DeSantis [signed into law](https://www.flgov.com/2021/05/03/governor-ron-desantis-signs-landmark-legislation-to-ban-vaccine-passports-and-stem-government-overreach/) legislation that bans vaccine passports, among other things. Georgia Georgia does not offer digital proof of vaccination. In May, 2021, Gov. Brian Kemp [issued](https://gov.georgia.gov/press-releases/2021-05-25/gov-kemp-issues-executive-order-prohibiting-covid-19-vaccine-passports) an executive order prohibiting vaccine passports. Hawaii Hawaii uses the [Smart Health Card](https://hawaiicovid19.com/smart-health-card/) system. Idaho Idaho does not offer digital proof of vaccination. In April, 2021, Gov. Brad Little [signed](https://gov.idaho.gov/pressrelease/gov-little-bans-vaccine-passports-in-idaho/) an executive order that banned vaccine passports. Illinois Illinois launched [Vax Verify](https://idphportal.illinois.gov/s/?language=en_US) in early August, 2021. It uses Experian to verify identity, an approach some privacy experts have [criticized](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2021/08/vaccine-passport-missteps-we-should-not-repeat). Indiana Indiana has offered electronic vaccination records [since 2012](https://medcitynews.com/2012/08/myvaxindiana-offers-online-access-to-electronic-copies-of-shot-records-for-hoosiers/) via MyVaxIndiana, but the website at [myvaxindiana.in.gov](https://myvaxindiana.in.gov/) is currently offline, and the [help desk](https://www.in.gov/health/immunization/) has not responded to questions. Iowa Iowa discontinued patients' access to their own [digital vaccine records](https://iris.iowa.gov/IRISPRDJ/portalInfoManager.do) in response to a state law banning vaccine passports, which the governor [signed](https://kwwl.com/2021/05/20/gov-reynolds-signs-bill-banning-vaccine-passports-in-iowa/) into law in May, 2021. [Tweet] Kansas Kansas does not offer digital proof of vaccination. "I have no interest in vaccine passports," Gov. Laura Kelly said in April, 2021, the AP [reported](https://www.kake.com/story/43605062/kansas-governor-no-interest-in-covid19-vaccine-passports). "We will not be issuing those under my authority." Kentucky Kentucky uses the [Smart Health Card system](https://www.chfs.ky.gov/agencies/dph/dehp/idb/Pages/kyirportal.aspx). Louisiana Louisiana uses [MyIR Mobile](https://myirmobile.com/louisiana-sign-in/). Maine Maine does not offer a digital vaccine record app, but you can request your immunization records via its [ImmPact system](https://www.maine.gov/dhhs/forms/immpact-immunization-record-request). Maryland Maryland uses [MyIR Mobile](https://md.myir.net/login/). Massachusetts Massachusetts uses [Smart Health Cards](https://www.myvaxrecords.mass.gov/). Michigan The [Michigan Immunization Portal](https://mdhhsmiimmsportal.state.mi.us/) lets you download your Immunization Record from the Michigan Care Improvement Registry. Minnesota Minnesota residents can use the [Docket app](https://docket.care/) once they have registered with the [Minnesota Immunization Information Connection](https://www.health.state.mn.us/people/immunize/miic/index.html). Mississippi Mississippi uses [MyIR Mobile](https://msdh.ms.gov/msdhsite/_static/14,0,71,969.html). Missouri Missouri does not offer digital proof of vaccination. In June, 2021, Gov. Mike Parson [signed](https://governor.mo.gov/press-releases/archive/governor-parson-signs-hb-271-regarding-local-public-health-orders-and) into law a bill that prohibits local COVID-19 vaccine passports. Montana Montana does not offer digital proof of vaccination. In April, 2021, Gov. Greg Gianforte [signed](https://news.mt.gov/Governors-Office/gov-gianforte-issues-executive-order-prohibiting-vaccine-passports) an executive order that bans the state from funding vaccine passports. Nebraska Nebraska does not offer digital proof of vaccination. "Nebraska will not participate in any vaccine passport program," Gov. Pete Ricketts [said in March 2021](https://journalstar.com/news/state-and-regional/govt-and-politics/ricketts-nebraska-will-not-participate-in-any-vaccine-passport-program/article_541b5bc2-0c20-562c-83c2-23ff454de65c.html). Though the state has a new governor, it still does not have a vaccine record app. Nevada Nevada uses [Smart Health Cards](https://nvhealthresponse.nv.gov/smart-health-qr-code/). New Hampshire New Hampshire does not use an app, but you can [download proof of vaccination](https://www.vaccines.nh.gov/vaccination-record-instructions). New Jersey New Jersey uses [Docket](https://docket.care/). You will [need](https://covid19.nj.gov/faqs/nj-information/slowing-the-spread/consumer-access-to-covid-19-immunization-records-with-docket-faqs) the phone number or email address on file associated with your COVID-19 immunization record. New Mexico In New Mexico, you can use [Vaxview NM](https://nmsiis.health.state.nm.us/webiznet_nm_public/Application/PublicPortal) to view and print an official record of immunizations. New York Statewide, New York has the [Excelsior Pass Plus](https://covid19vaccine.health.ny.gov/excelsior-pass-and-excelsior-pass-plus), which produces a pass with a QR code that people can store in digital wallets. New York City also has the Covid Safe app ( [iOS](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/nyc-covid-safe/id1565213506) and [Android](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=gov.nyc.doitt.covidsafe&hl=en_US&gl=US)). North Carolina North Carolina has a [COVID-19 Vaccine Portal](https://covid-vaccine-portal.ncdhhs.gov/s/?language=en_US) that lets you download a vaccine record. North Dakota North Dakota uses [MyIR Mobile](https://www.hhs.nd.gov/health/diseases-conditions-and-immunization/immunizations/immunization-record-request). Ohio Ohio does not offer digital proof of vaccination. Health officials have said they're [not pursuing](https://spectrumnews1.com/oh/columbus/news/2021/05/17/ohio-vaccine-passport-covid19-digital-verify-coronavirus-qr-code) vaccine passports. Oklahoma Oklahoma has viewable/printable/savable records online at the [Oklahoma State Immunization Information System](https://osiis.health.ok.gov/osiis_public/Application/PublicPortal). Oregon Oregon has its own [digital record system](https://myelectronicvaccinecard.oregon.gov/). Pennsylvania Pennsylvania does not offer digital proof of vaccination, but you can request a [copy of your records](https://www.health.pa.gov/topics/Reporting-Registries/PA-SIIS/Pages/PA-SIIS.aspx). Rhode Island Rhode Island uses its own [401Health app](https://covid.ri.gov/covid-19-prevention/401health-app). You can also view and print a copy of your record through its [vaccine portal](https://portal.ri.gov/VaccineRecord/s/). South Carolina South Carolina does not offer digital proof of vaccination. In May, 2021, Gov. Henry McMaster signed an [executive order](https://governor.sc.gov/sites/default/files/Documents/Executive-Orders/2021-05-22%20FINAL%20Executive%20Order%20No.%202021-25%20-%20State%20of%20Emergency.pdf) that bans state agencies from developing, issuing, or requiring the presentation of a vaccine passport. South Dakota South Dakota does not offer digital proof of vaccination. In April, 2021, Gov. Kristi Noem [signed](https://apnews.com/article/health-coronavirus-pandemic-south-dakota-ca70ac1ed103fc38f5678777eadb3d42) an executive order banning government-instituted vaccine passports in the state. Tennessee Tennessee does not offer digital proof of vaccination but you can request a [copy of your records](https://www.tn.gov/health/cedep/immunization-program/ip/imm-record-request.html). Texas Texas does not offer digital proof of vaccination. In April, 2021, Gov. Greg Abbott signed an executive order banning state agencies from requiring vaccine passports. [Tweet] Utah Utah uses [Docket](https://docket.care/). Vermont Vermont does not offer digital proof of vaccination. Virginia Virginia has a QR code-based vaccination record available from its [Vaccinate Virginia](https://vaccinate.virginia.gov/) site. Washington Washington uses [MyIR Mobile](https://myirmobile.com/). West Virginia West Virginia does not offer digital proof of vaccination, but you can [request a replacement card online](https://dhhr.wv.gov/COVID-19/pages/replacement-card.aspx). Wisconsin Wisconsin has viewable/printable/savable records online through the Wisconsin Immunization Registry in [English](https://www.dhfswir.org/PR/clientSearch.do?language=en), [Spanish](https://www.dhfswir.org/PR/clientSearch.do?language=es), and [Hmong](https://www.dhfswir.org/PR/clientSearch.do?language=hm). Wyoming Wyoming does not offer digital proof of vaccination. In May, 2021, Gov. Mark Gordon [issued a directive](https://www.wyomingnews.com/coronavirus/gov-gordon-issues-directive-banning-vaccine-passports/article_c78593bc-c954-5155-9f1d-d327b5c7743d.html) that bans vaccine passports.
